title: Ticket #2702: Document DAGMan file descriptor issues
description:
We should document the issues DAGMan currently has with the number of file descriptors that it may need (depending on the structure of the DAG, etc.).
  • If you have a very wide DAG, and each node job has a separate log file, this will cause DAGMan to have many file descriptors open at once (e.g., 10,000 or more if your DAG is wide enough).
  • I think the default limit for file descriptors for a process on Linux is 10k, but the limit on Windows is currently 512. Z is planning to raise this to 2048 (the most we can have using the C runtime).
  • A workaround is to have the node jobs share the same log file (an easy way is by not specifying a log file at all in your submit files -- DAGMan will supply a default).
